INTERACTIVE MEDIA

Interactive Media concerns all forms of interactivity within virtual environments. It tackles Human-Computer Interaction at its core, from the research process to the development of interactive technologies themselves.

Play around with the console buttons or w/a/s/d to see more!

WEB PROGRAMMING

FRONTEND

UI/UX

REST API

DATA VIS.

As a course requirement for MIS 121 and 131 (Systems Analysis and Design), my group created a website for a flowershop. Here, I used CSS with bootstrap to create the interface for the shop, while our backend developer used python with django to handle the shop's inventory and user systems.
BS MIS' two major projects involved creating software solutions for partner companies. I was my groups' point person for UI/UX design for both projects. For MIS131 Final, I designed the UI for our online shop using AdobeXD, and for our thesis, I used Figma and Balsamiq alongside our frontend developer to design the wireframes for our ERP App Solution.
My first encounter with REST APIs was in my Web Programming class where we used JavaScript to fetch dummy text from JSONPlaceholder to simulate a blog website. I was able to use this knowledge during my internship at Proudcloud where I worked with the IoT Team.
During my internship at Proudcloud, I worked with the Internet of Things team to complete their weather diagnosis system. Here, I learned how to use various technologies with python, including data visualisation with matplotlib.

Languages and tools known: CSS, Flask, HTML, JavaScript, PHP, Python, SCSS

GAME DESIGN

I undertook four Game Development and Design courses to complete my specialization. These introduced me to the behind the scenes of Video Game Production, after which I pitched and presented game ideas and wrote a game design document. As a group final project, we created a simple asteroid shooter game using C++ and SFML.

Languages and tools known: C#, C++, SFML
